blocks.value: I'm a fellow at the New York Times as a part of the 2024-25 NYT Fellowship Class. I write for The Upshot where I cover politics, sports, pop culture and more. You can check out what I’ve worked on so far here. Next year, I’ll be starting my Ph.D. in Political Science at MIT. Broadly, I’m interested in the intersection between political science, public policy, and statistical and computational methods.

In Spring 2024, I graduated from Boston University with a B.A. in Computer Science and Statistics and a minor in Public Policy Analysis. At BU, I worked closely with Prof. Maxwell Palmer on various projects including estimating turnout differences among demographic groups in mayoral elections and using car registration data and vector embeddings to predict party registration from car makes and models.
